availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James H. Lowry (Jessamine County, Kentucky, justice of the peace and farmer)

body.p: Jessamine County, Kentucky, justice of the peace and farmer. Married to Nancy Lowry. Father of James K. Lowry and Margaret Lowry. Married to Jane Lowry. Father of Virginia Lowry, Louis S. Lowry, John P. Lowry, and William C. Lowry. Farmer in Jessamine County in 1850. Owned thirty-one enslaved persons in Jessamine County in 1850. Farmer in Jessamine County in 1860. Owned thirty-nine enslaved persons in Jessamine County in 1860. Justice of the peace in Jessamine County in 1860 and 1861.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jessamine County, District 2, p. 79A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Jessamine County, District 2, p. 82.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jessamine County, p. 145.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Jessamine County, p. 313A-B
